extracted_data_phrases: by failing to follow their reasonable instructions
disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents by failing to follow their reasonable instructions?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: in matters that require their authority
disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents in matters that require their authority?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: with individuals who were a part of it
disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when frustrated with individuals who were a part of it, even if they had flaws?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you intentionally disregard prescribed days for self-denial and penance, such as during Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

extracted_data_phrases: for the dignity of the deceased
disobedience.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not properly buried, demonstrating disrespect for the dignity of the deceased?
disobedience.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

disobedience.question: Did you mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Have I used my words to ridicule the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday that could otherwise have been avoided
disobedience.question: Did I engage in work on a Sunday that could otherwise have been avoided, disrespecting the day's significance?
disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

condoning.question: Did I lead other Catholics to believe that staying away from Sacraments or Mass was an acceptable choice by my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from participating in sacraments or attending Mass
condoning.question: Did I use my words to discourage fellow Catholics from participating in sacraments or attending Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I use my words to encourage other Catholics from attending Sacraments or Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by avoiding a difficult conversation about their spiritual guidance
condoning.question: Did I permit my child to continue in sin by avoiding a difficult conversation about their spiritual guidance?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

extracted_data_phrases: instead of guiding them towards truth
condoning.question: Did I fail to address my child's spiritual needs by avoiding difficult conversations, instead of guiding them towards truth?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

extracted_data_phrases: to bad influences that might lead them astray from their faith
condoning.question: Did I permit my child to be exposed to bad influences that might lead them astray from their faith?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

extracted_data_phrases: to influences that could lead them away from faith
condoning.question: Did I permit my child to be exposed to influences that could lead them away from faith?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

extracted_data_phrases: through our social media use , television watching , or other activities we engage that in together
condoning.question: Did I permit my child to be exposed to bad influences through our social media use, television watching, or other activities that we engage in together?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by giving my silent approval when I could have spoken out against it
condoning.question: Did I condone another Catholic to marry outside the Church by giving my silent approval when I could have spoken out against it?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I give tacit approval to another Catholic through my words, indicating that they could marry outside of the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: for marrying outside of the Church
condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic, in any circumstance, for marrying outside of the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: from strangers and those who are displaced
uncharity.question: Do you turn away from strangers and those who are displaced, showing indifference to their plight?
uncharity.description: Per the corporal works of mercy, we are to love our neighbors by feeding the hungry and sheltering the homeless and respecting their dignity especially in times of hardship.

extracted_data_phrases: upon others based on their job , nationality , or other trait
on their job , nationality , or other trait
uncharity.question: Do I look down upon others based on their job, nationality, or other trait?
uncharity.description: This sin dehumanizes people on the margins when we are called to love each other as a child of God as Jesus loved us.

extracted_data_phrases: over the well - being , needs , and concerns of others
uncharity.question: Did I prioritize my own comfort, convenience, and desires over the well-being, needs, and concerns of others?
uncharity.description: This is considered sinful because excessive self-focus and selfishness violates Christ's command to love our neighbors as ourselves and contradicts the Christian call to practice charity, compassion, and self-sacrifice for others.

extracted_data_phrases: above those of my family , friends , and community
of my family , friends , and community

uncharity.description: This is considered sinful because excessive self-focus and selfishness violates Christ's command to love our neighbors as ourselves and contradicts the Christian call to practice charity, compassion, and self-sacrifice for others.

uncharity.question: Have you disrespected others as children of God through your thoughts?
uncharity.description: Treating others with disrespect denies their inherent dignity as beings created in God's image and violates Christ's command to love one another as He has loved us.

extracted_data_phrases: in my words and actions towards others
by diminishing their inherent dignity as children of God
uncharity.question: Have I, in my words and actions towards others, shown disrespect by diminishing their inherent dignity as children of God?
uncharity.description: Treating others with disrespect denies their inherent dignity as beings created in God's image and violates Christ's command to love one another as He has loved us.

extracted_data_phrases: especially in situations where I feel frustrated or overwhelmed by their needs or requests
uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience with others, especially in situations where I feel frustrated or overwhelmed by their needs or requests?
uncharity.description: Losing patience with others fails to reflect God's infinite patience with us and violates Christ's command to love our neighbor, instead allowing anger and frustration to override charity and kindness.

uncharity.question: Did I permit someone to be treated unfairly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Did you permit another person to be treated unfairly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Did I permit someone to suffer unjust treatment in my presence?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Did I speak condescendingly to someone about the Church?
uncharity.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

uncharity.question: Have I not helped those who were in need of my assistance?
uncharity.description: Refusing to help those in need violates Jesus's direct command to love our neighbor and practice the works of mercy, as illustrated in the parable of the Good Samaritan.

uncharity.question: Have I not helped those in genuine need when they asked for assistance?
uncharity.description: Refusing to help those in need violates Jesus's direct command to love our neighbor and practice the works of mercy, as illustrated in the parable of the Good Samaritan.

extracted_data_phrases: such as strangers , acquaintances , or those less fortunate than myself

uncharity.description: Failing to help those in need violates Christ's direct command to love our neighbor and care for the poor, effectively refusing to recognize Jesus Himself in the suffering of others.

extracted_data_phrases: by being present , attentive , and supportive
uncharity.question: Have I demonstrated practical assistance to those in need by being present, attentive, and supportive?
uncharity.description: Failing to help those in need violates Christ's direct command to love our neighbor and care for the poor, effectively refusing to recognize Jesus Himself in the suffering of others.

sloth.question: Am I neglecting opportunities to grow in my faith through periods of spiritual stagnation?
sloth.description: Lukewarmness in spiritual growth is sinful because one essentially chooses comfort and mediocrity over the transformative love God offers, which Jesus specifically warned against in Revelation 3:16.

extracted_data_phrases: perhaps through illness , accident , or other difficult circumstances
sloth.question: Did you turn away from those who were struggling, perhaps through illness, accident, or other difficult circumstances, and needed my help?
sloth.description: Neglecting the sick violates Jesus's direct command to care for the ill as if they were Christ himself.

extracted_data_phrases: with adequate spiritual guidance and formation in their faith

lukewarmness.description: Lukewarmness in spiritual growth is sinful because one essentially chooses comfort and mediocrity over the transformative love God offers, which Jesus specifically warned against in Revelation 3:16.

merciless.question: Have I spoken harshly or critically of others, causing them to feel condemned?
merciless.description: Condemning others is a sin of mercilessness because it places oneself in God's role as judge and denies others the same mercy and forgiveness that God extends to all of us.

callousness.question: Did I fail to help someone who was suffering when they needed my assistance?

callousness.question: Did you turn away from someone who was ill?

vainglory.question: Did I seek praise from others for my charitable giving?

extracted_data_phrases: in enabling me to achieve them
autonomy.question: Did I take for granted God's providence in my accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge His role in enabling me to achieve them?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envy towards others' blessings, wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their blessings, especially those related to success and achievement?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others through social media, leading me to use vulgar or inappropriate language that violates their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a manner that was inconsistent with my Christian values
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in a manner that was inconsistent with my Christian values, using language that was unbecoming of a child of God?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
especially during social gatherings or when trying new restaurants
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during social gatherings or when trying new restaurants?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
in activities that involve consuming food and drinks
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when partaking in social events or engaging in activities that involve consuming food and drinks?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking on special occasions , such as holidays or social gatherings
on special occasions , such as holidays or social gatherings
such as holidays or social gatherings
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking on special occasions, such as holidays or social gatherings?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking to excess
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking to excess, especially when it compromised my relationship with God or others?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively and wastefully risked financial resources entrusted to me for frivolous pursuits, giving priority over my family's and others' needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing private conversations, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I shared others' personal affairs, even if true, for my own entertainment or to impress others in social settings?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in order to entertain myself or others
gossip.question: Have I used my words to share others' private affairs, even if they were true, in order to entertain myself or others?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided
impiety.question: Did I engage in work on a Sunday when it otherwise could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: for something other than rest on Sunday
impiety.question: Did I use my skills and abilities for something other than rest on Sunday, when otherwise it could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impurity.question: Have you intentionally used practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy within a committed romantic relationship?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.
